page.title: 20Geography and Environment.
page.content: Drained by River Lodon,Hackley Brook. Three natural springs,one in village; still providing fresh water and water- cress for villagers. North West of Hawkhurst,on the River Lodon,is a natural ford,a weir is down river above Hyde Bridge. Nature of ground is mainly pasture; although wheat,barley and rape seed are grown throughout area.Common Market subsidies have recently encouraged the spread of the rape seed crop. Some evidence of medieval strip farming_mixed fields,scattered ownership of fields.Animals;pigs,dairy cattle and sheep,are commonly farmed. Trees are scattered and mainly deciduous. Due to location,Pencombe Village remains isolated during heavy snow. Flooding blocks main access roads.
